title: Ticket #1811: should_transfer=IF_NEEDED incorrectly handles paths to stdout/stderr
description:
When should_transfer_files=IF_NEEDED, and output or error are set to something other than a simple basename, condor_submit sets the filename to _condor_stdout/_condor_stderr and uses transfer_output_remaps to specify the actual path. However, if no file transfer is used (because the submit and execute FileSystemDomain values match), then the remaps are not applied, and the output gets written to _condor_stdout/_condor_stderr rather than the paths specified by the user.

A related problem to this one is that scheduler universe jobs which try to turn on file transfer have similar problems with _condor_stdout/_condor_stderr if the output files contain paths.
remarks:
2011-Aug-29 12:04:39 by tannenba:
In addition, IF_NEEDED is borked when submitting to local and scheduler universes.

In ticket #2273 the default was changed to IF_NEEDED. However, this ticket really needs to be resolved before that change can happen. Commit [27009] sets the default in condor_submit back to how they were since the dawn of time. Once the problems are associated with this ticket are fixed, [27009] should be reverted and #2273 resolved.
